alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 1:34AM EST until December 28 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Delaware... Red Clay Creek At Wooddale affecting New Castle County. For the Red Clay Creek...including Wooddale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red Clay Creek at Wooddale. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Flooding begins in adjacent open fields. At 7.5 feet, Barley Mill Road begins to flood. Brandywine Springs Park floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.4 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage later this morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.3 feet on 03/11/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Red Clay Creek Wooddale 7.0 6.8 Thu 1 am 3.1 MSG 7.4 3am 12/28 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1000 AM EST.
